revised_title: Autoionization Resonances and Configuration-Mixing in Emission Spectra of Zn I and Cd I
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the autoionization resonances and configuration-mixing in the emission spectra of Zn I and Cd I. They identified the nsnp features in both Zn and Cd and found that the autoionization probability for the Cd level is 4.16 and for the Zn level is 0. They determined the configuration-mixing coefficients and the capture cross-section for the continuum associated with the resonance at 310.7. This study helps to understand the behavior of atoms and their interactions with radiation.
